notesStmt.note: Printer's name and place of publication from STC.
"The collectour and translatour of this presente manual, to the Catholicke and Christian reader" is signed: G.F., i.e. George Flinton.

Includes: Certaine devoute and godly petitions, commonly called. Iesus Psalter. Cum privilegio. Anno. 1583., which was first published in 1529 with the title: Ihesus. An inuocacyon gloryous named ye psalter of Iesus; it is sometimes attributed to Richard Whitford; in this edition it has separate title page and register.
Also includes: A shorte dialogue of S. Katerine of Siene touching perfection.
Identified as STC 4816 on UMI microfilm reel 190.
Imperfect as filmed; reel 190 includes only the Short Dialogue; reel 938 lacks all after the title page of the Iesus Psalter.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
Appears at UMI microfilm reels 190 and 928 (both Bodleian Library copy).
